description: From Latin dēspondeō (“give up, abandon”), from dē (“from”) +‎ spondeō (“promise”).

verbs.description: despond (third-person singular simple present desponds, present participle desponding, simple past and past participle desponded)

entries.meaning: To give up the will, courage, or spirit; to become dejected, lose heart.
examples: I should despair, or at least despond.
